intro: Oenanthe daucifolia, commonly known as water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist environments such as stream banks and wet meadows, often growing in shallow water. Oenanthe daucifolia is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
